title: 15+ Best Tall Fonts to Elevate Your Designs
description: Discover the best tall fonts for your next design project with our comprehensive blog post. Enhance your typography game and stand out from the crowd.
author: Jacob Cass
excerpt: Discover the best tall fonts for your next design project with our comprehensive blog post. Enhance your typography game and stand out from the crowd.
text: Are you searching for the perfect tall font to add a touch of elevated style and personality to your text? Look no further, as we have compiled a list of over 15 stunning tall fonts that are perfect for any project. Tall fonts are fonts that have elongated or stretched letters, creating a unique and eye-catching effect. They can be used for logos, headlines, posters, or social media graphics, to make a statement and grab attention. But with so many tall fonts out there, how do you choose the right one for your project? In this article, we’ll show you over 15 of the most stylish and elegant tall fonts that you can use for any occasion and purpose. UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Download all the Tall Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)! 15+ Best Tall Fonts for Elevated Designs 1. Psilographer The Psilographer is a super condensed type style that we absolutely adore. It’s the perfect combination of modernity and casualness, making it stand out from the rest. Not only does it add a touch of sophistication to any design, but it also pairs well with basic sans serif fonts for a more contemporary feel. Imagine using it for headlines, tall-format prints, posters, or displays – the possibilities are endless! Trust us when we say that the Psilographer will leave a lasting impression on your audience. So, if you’re looking to make a statement with your typography, this type style is definitely worth considering! 2. Aeternus Variable Get ready to meet the newest addition to our typography favorites – Aeternus Variable! This geometric Sans Serif Variable typeface is the perfect blend of modernity. With its combination of different heights and weights, Aeternus Variable is a true game-changer in the world of typography. It offers a whole new world of possibilities in text usage, making it perfect for any design project you have in mind. One of the standout features of this font family is its nine instances, ranging from Thin to Heavy, including two constant heights – Nano and Tall. But what really sets Aeternus apart is its unique ability to vary in height while maintaining constant weights in Thin and Heavy. 3. Vienna Woodtype Adding Vienna Woodtype to the list, we adore this tall and cool font for its distinctive and eye-catching appearance. Inspired by classic woodtype designs, it features bold and geometric letterforms with a rustic texture. This font can add a vintage and authentic feel to any project, and its tall stature makes it perfect for headlines and display use. Whether used in a clean or rough version, Vienna Woodtype is a versatile font that can work well in a range of design contexts. 4. Garry Tall On our second list, we are thrilled to introduce Garry Tall, a stunning handwritten sans-serif tall font that’s perfect for creating eye-catching designs. Whether you’re designing quotes, blog headers, posters, branding, logos, or any other project, Garry Tall is a great choice. Its all caps design makes it stand out, giving your designs a bold and powerful feel. So if you’re looking for a font that will help you make a statement, look no further than Garry Tall. 5. Goofers Introducing Goofers, the unique and casual script font that’s perfect for adding a touch of fun to your designs. With its clean mono-line stroke and fun characters, this font is sure to make your designs stand out. Goofers also includes a variety of ligatures and alternates to give you even more creative options. What’s more, Goofers supports multilingual use in over 100+ languages, making it a versatile font that can be used for a wide range of projects. Whether you’re designing a logo, social media graphics, movie titles, book titles, or even just a short or long text, Goofers is the perfect choice. It also works well as a secondary text font when paired with a sans or serif font. 6. Tall Boy We absolutely adore Tall Boy! This playful handmade font is perfect for taking your designs to the next level. Whether you’re creating logos, posters, apparel, or products, Tall Boy is sure to make your designs stand out. This all-caps font family includes a “high font” and a “low font” in regular, italic, and bold styles, giving you a wide range of options to choose from. What’s more, Tall Boy also includes punctuation and numbers, making it a versatile font that’s perfect for any project. 7. High Version Glorynight We’re absolutely in love with High Version Glorynight! This stunning typeface is perfect for adding a touch of masculinity, class, and strength to your designs. With its octagonal form and sleek lines, the High Version Glorynight is versatile and suitable for a wide range of design needs, and this tall font may be just what you need. Whether you’re creating designs for technology, sports, fashion, modern branding, advertising, print identity, magazines, websites, mobile applications, and more, Glorynight Tall Version is a perfect choice. 8. Margrite Margrite – a tall and condensed serif typeface family consisting of light, regular, and bold fonts – is simply breathtaking. Its sleek and elegant design is perfect for all kinds of modern and sophisticated designs that require more vertical room, such as regular-sized posters and flyers. By combining the different weights of Margrite, you can create bold and round titles, accents, and copy text that will catch the eye of anyone who sees it. With all caps and tracking, you can also experiment with unique combinations to create a one-of-a-kind look. 9. Disorder We are thrilled to introduce Disorder – a fun, joyful, and tall handwritten font that will bring a touch of playfulness to your designs. With its friendly and approachable design, Murky is perfect for creating unique designs that stand out from the crowd. This font is particularly well-suited for children’s themed designs, especially when combined with bright colors. Whether you’re designing invitations, greeting cards, posters, or social media graphics, Murky is sure to add a fun and playful touch to your project. 10. MTC Quinnie If you’re looking for a versatile and stunning typeface that will elevate your design projects, look no further than MTC Quinnie. This condensed serif font boasts an extensive set of alternates and ligatures, providing a wide range of creative options for designers and editorial projects. With its smooth and elegant serifs, MTC Quinnie is perfect for creating elegant and refined designs. The use of alternates and ligatures adds visual interest and variety, allowing designers to create unique and customized typography that stands out from the crowd. 11. Firecracker On our next list, we are thrilled again to introduce Firecracker, a perfect font that is a true blast from the past. This font will take you back to the vibrant and exciting era of the 1950s and 1960s, with its beautiful letters that evoke the energy and enthusiasm of that time. Firecracker is perfect for use in magazines, newspapers, signage, branding, packaging, and more. With two different styles, regular and oblique, you can add a touch of retro flair to any creative design. 12. Philipa With its unique tall letterforms and charming handcrafted style, Philipa is the perfect choice for any design project that requires a touch of personality and character. Its readability and versatility make it suitable for a wide range of applications, from branding and advertising to packaging and product design. And with its down-to-earth charm, Philipa is sure to become a favorite among designers and creatives looking for a font that’s both stylish to any design inspiration. 13. Mangosteen On the first list, we have an amazing font that we absolutely love! Mangosteen, the playful stunning font that’s sure to add a touch of tons and fun to your designs. This trendy and cute display font is perfect for a wide range of projects, including Cricut designs, procreate art, crafting, branding, decorating, farmhouse designs, shirt designs, SVG designs, blog graphics, logos, invitations, and so much more. But that’s not all! This font is also perfect for your business needs, such as book covers, stationery, marketing materials, magazines, and any other project that requires a fun and personalized touch. 14. Aracne We love how the Aracne collection offers so many options for designers, with the regular, condensed, and ultra condensed styles. The addition of Aracne Soft and Stamp also provides even more versatility for different design needs. And with support for multiple languages, it’s a great choice for designers working on global projects. 15. Pannic Pannic Font is a powerful typeface with a unique, modern look that is sure to make your designs stand out. Its bold, tall letters are perfect for headlines, titles, logos, and branding. This techno font has a sleek and contemporary feel that is versatile and can be used in a variety of design contexts, from print to digital. With its sharp lines and attention-grabbing style, Pannic Font is sure to make an impact on any project. 16. Vintage Brothers On our next list, we have Vintage Brothers font, a monoline font that features a tall and thin shape, giving it a natural handwriting look. The font is designed with a simple and minimalistic appearance, making it perfect for various project designs. Its simplicity makes it versatile and suitable for use in branding, packaging, logos, headlines, and more. Brothers font is also available in different weights, allowing for greater flexibility and creativity in your designs. 17. Beardman Beardman is a versatile and wonderful font that can be used for a wide range of design projects. Its condensed form factor makes it ideal for creating impactful and attention-grabbing headlines, titles, and other text elements. The inclusion of both regular and italic variants, as well as outline versions, provides flexibility and allows for creative experimentation. With its unique name and combination of strength and softness, Beardman is a font that will make a statement in any design. 18. Santa Rosa The Santa Rosa Font Duo is a great choice for designers looking for an amazing typeface. With its vintage woodblock-inspired display face and wide, complementary sans-serif, this duo can be used for a variety of design projects. The smooth and rough textures, as well as the support for dozens of languages, including Greek, make it a great option for bold layouts, unexpected advertising, distressed graphics, and more. 19. Rogbold Introducing Rogbold – a sleek and modern condensed font that pairs elegance with impact. Designed to make a statement, this font is ideal for bold headlines, eye-catching posters, professional branding, and stylish packaging. What we love about Rogbold is its versatility and refined aesthetic, making it perfect for adding a polished, professional touch to any design. It’s clean lines and compact form work beautifully across projects, from logos to magazines, bringing a contemporary edge that commands attention while maintaining sophistication. 20. Gotalls Gotalls – a bold and dynamic sports typeface that’s crafted for impact. With its large italic style, modern cutouts, and athletic slant, this font is perfect for adding energy to your designs. Gotalls is ideal for sports headlines, football logos, collegiate themes, and university banners, offering impressive readability and a powerful presence. From soccer to hockey, this font brings a bold, custom feel to any athletic project, making it a winning choice for any high-impact design. Our Favorite Tall Fonts Still undecided? No problem. We’ve narrowed down the list and selected our top 12 best tall fonts just for you. Psilograph Best Tall Font Garry Tall Best Tall Font Tall Boy Best Tall Font Santa Rosa Best Tall Font Aracne Best Tall Font Brothers Best Tall Font Murky Best Tall Font MTC Quinnie Best Tall Font Pannic Best Tall Font Mangosteen Best Tall Font Beardman Best Tall Font Margrite Best Tall Font Bold Fonts Edgy Fonts Thin Fonts Thick Fonts Best Tall Fonts Summary Choosing the right typefaces is crucial in making a visual statement and capturing the attention of your audience. When it comes to tall fonts, there are plenty of options to choose from that can enhance the aesthetic appeal of your designs, whether for personal projects or professional work. Whether you’re looking for something modern, elegant, or playful, from premium options to free alternatives – there’s a tall font out there that can suit your needs. By taking into account the factors mentioned in this blog post such as legibility, style, and versatility, you can make an informed decision and select the best tall font for your next project. With the right choice of font, you can elevate the impact of your designs and create a memorable experience for your viewers.
html:
Are you searching for the perfect tall font to add a touch of elevated style and personality to your text?

Look no further, as we have compiled a list of over 15 stunning tall fonts that are perfect for any project.

Tall fonts are fonts that have elongated or stretched letters, creating a unique and eye-catching effect. They can be used for logos, headlines, posters, or social media graphics, to make a statement and grab attention.

But with so many tall fonts out there, how do you choose the right one for your project?

In this article, we’ll show you over 15 of the most stylish and elegant tall fonts that you can use for any occasion and purpose.

UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets

Download all the Tall Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)!

15+ Best Tall Fonts for Elevated Designs

1. Psilographer

The Psilographer is a super condensed type style that we absolutely adore. It’s the perfect combination of modernity and casualness, making it stand out from the rest.

Not only does it add a touch of sophistication to any design, but it also pairs well with basic sans serif fonts for a more contemporary feel. Imagine using it for headlines, tall-format prints, posters, or displays – the possibilities are endless!

Trust us when we say that the Psilographer will leave a lasting impression on your audience. So, if you’re looking to make a statement with your typography, this type style is definitely worth considering!

2. Aeternus Variable

Get ready to meet the newest addition to our typography favorites – Aeternus Variable! This geometric Sans Serif Variable typeface is the perfect blend of modernity.

With its combination of different heights and weights, Aeternus Variable is a true game-changer in the world of typography. It offers a whole new world of possibilities in text usage, making it perfect for any design project you have in mind.

One of the standout features of this font family is its nine instances, ranging from Thin to Heavy, including two constant heights – Nano and Tall.

But what really sets Aeternus apart is its unique ability to vary in height while maintaining constant weights in Thin and Heavy.

3. Vienna Woodtype

Adding Vienna Woodtype to the list, we adore this tall and cool font for its distinctive and eye-catching appearance. Inspired by classic woodtype designs, it features bold and geometric letterforms with a rustic texture.

This font can add a vintage and authentic feel to any project, and its tall stature makes it perfect for headlines and display use. Whether used in a clean or rough version, Vienna Woodtype is a versatile font that can work well in a range of design contexts.

4. Garry Tall

On our second list, we are thrilled to introduce Garry Tall, a stunning handwritten sans-serif tall font that’s perfect for creating eye-catching designs.

Whether you’re designing quotes, blog headers, posters, branding, logos, or any other project, Garry Tall is a great choice.

Its all caps design makes it stand out, giving your designs a bold and powerful feel. So if you’re looking for a font that will help you make a statement, look no further than Garry Tall.

5. Goofers

Introducing Goofers, the unique and casual script font that’s perfect for adding a touch of fun to your designs. With its clean mono-line stroke and fun characters, this font is sure to make your designs stand out.

Goofers also includes a variety of ligatures and alternates to give you even more creative options.

What’s more, Goofers supports multilingual use in over 100+ languages, making it a versatile font that can be used for a wide range of projects.

Whether you’re designing a logo, social media graphics, movie titles, book titles, or even just a short or long text, Goofers is the perfect choice. It also works well as a secondary text font when paired with a sans or serif font.

6. Tall Boy

We absolutely adore Tall Boy! This playful handmade font is perfect for taking your designs to the next level.

Whether you’re creating logos, posters, apparel, or products, Tall Boy is sure to make your designs stand out. This all-caps font family includes a “high font” and a “low font” in regular, italic, and bold styles, giving you a wide range of options to choose from.

What’s more, Tall Boy also includes punctuation and numbers, making it a versatile font that’s perfect for any project.

7. High Version Glorynight

We’re absolutely in love with High Version Glorynight! This stunning typeface is perfect for adding a touch of masculinity, class, and strength to your designs.

With its octagonal form and sleek lines, the High Version Glorynight is versatile and suitable for a wide range of design needs, and this tall font may be just what you need.

Whether you’re creating designs for technology, sports, fashion, modern branding, advertising, print identity, magazines, websites, mobile applications, and more, Glorynight Tall Version is a perfect choice.

8. Margrite

Margrite – a tall and condensed serif typeface family consisting of light, regular, and bold fonts – is simply breathtaking. Its sleek and elegant design is perfect for all kinds of modern and sophisticated designs that require more vertical room, such as regular-sized posters and flyers.

By combining the different weights of Margrite, you can create bold and round titles, accents, and copy text that will catch the eye of anyone who sees it.

With all caps and tracking, you can also experiment with unique combinations to create a one-of-a-kind look.

9. Disorder

We are thrilled to introduce Disorder – a fun, joyful, and tall handwritten font that will bring a touch of playfulness to your designs. With its friendly and approachable design, Murky is perfect for creating unique designs that stand out from the crowd.

This font is particularly well-suited for children’s themed designs, especially when combined with bright colors.

Whether you’re designing invitations, greeting cards, posters, or social media graphics, Murky is sure to add a fun and playful touch to your project.

10. MTC Quinnie

If you’re looking for a versatile and stunning typeface that will elevate your design projects, look no further than MTC Quinnie. This condensed serif font boasts an extensive set of alternates and ligatures, providing a wide range of creative options for designers and editorial projects.

With its smooth and elegant serifs, MTC Quinnie is perfect for creating elegant and refined designs.

The use of alternates and ligatures adds visual interest and variety, allowing designers to create unique and customized typography that stands out from the crowd.

11. Firecracker

On our next list, we are thrilled again to introduce Firecracker, a perfect font that is a true blast from the past.

This font will take you back to the vibrant and exciting era of the 1950s and 1960s, with its beautiful letters that evoke the energy and enthusiasm of that time. Firecracker is perfect for use in magazines, newspapers, signage, branding, packaging, and more.

With two different styles, regular and oblique, you can add a touch of retro flair to any creative design.

12. Philipa

With its unique tall letterforms and charming handcrafted style, Philipa is the perfect choice for any design project that requires a touch of personality and character. Its readability and versatility make it suitable for a wide range of applications, from branding and advertising to packaging and product design.

And with its down-to-earth charm, Philipa is sure to become a favorite among designers and creatives looking for a font that’s both stylish to any design inspiration.

13. Mangosteen

On the first list, we have an amazing font that we absolutely love! Mangosteen, the playful stunning font that’s sure to add a touch of tons and fun to your designs.

This trendy and cute display font is perfect for a wide range of projects, including Cricut designs, procreate art, crafting, branding, decorating, farmhouse designs, shirt designs, SVG designs, blog graphics, logos, invitations, and so much more.

But that’s not all! This font is also perfect for your business needs, such as book covers, stationery, marketing materials, magazines, and any other project that requires a fun and personalized touch.

14. Aracne

We love how the Aracne collection offers so many options for designers, with the regular, condensed, and ultra condensed styles. The addition of Aracne Soft and Stamp also provides even more versatility for different design needs.

And with support for multiple languages, it’s a great choice for designers working on global projects.

15. Pannic

Pannic Font is a powerful typeface with a unique, modern look that is sure to make your designs stand out. Its bold, tall letters are perfect for headlines, titles, logos, and branding.

This techno font has a sleek and contemporary feel that is versatile and can be used in a variety of design contexts, from print to digital.

With its sharp lines and attention-grabbing style, Pannic Font is sure to make an impact on any project.

16. Vintage Brothers

On our next list, we have Vintage Brothers font, a monoline font that features a tall and thin shape, giving it a natural handwriting look.

The font is designed with a simple and minimalistic appearance, making it perfect for various project designs.

Its simplicity makes it versatile and suitable for use in branding, packaging, logos, headlines, and more. Brothers font is also available in different weights, allowing for greater flexibility and creativity in your designs.

17. Beardman

Beardman is a versatile and wonderful font that can be used for a wide range of design projects. Its condensed form factor makes it ideal for creating impactful and attention-grabbing headlines, titles, and other text elements.

The inclusion of both regular and italic variants, as well as outline versions, provides flexibility and allows for creative experimentation.

With its unique name and combination of strength and softness, Beardman is a font that will make a statement in any design.

18. Santa Rosa

The Santa Rosa Font Duo is a great choice for designers looking for an amazing typeface.

With its vintage woodblock-inspired display face and wide, complementary sans-serif, this duo can be used for a variety of design projects.

The smooth and rough textures, as well as the support for dozens of languages, including Greek, make it a great option for bold layouts, unexpected advertising, distressed graphics, and more.

19. Rogbold

Introducing Rogbold – a sleek and modern condensed font that pairs elegance with impact. Designed to make a statement, this font is ideal for bold headlines, eye-catching posters, professional branding, and stylish packaging.

What we love about Rogbold is its versatility and refined aesthetic, making it perfect for adding a polished, professional touch to any design.

It’s clean lines and compact form work beautifully across projects, from logos to magazines, bringing a contemporary edge that commands attention while maintaining sophistication.

20. Gotalls

Gotalls – a bold and dynamic sports typeface that’s crafted for impact. With its large italic style, modern cutouts, and athletic slant, this font is perfect for adding energy to your designs.

Gotalls is ideal for sports headlines, football logos, collegiate themes, and university banners, offering impressive readability and a powerful presence. From soccer to hockey, this font brings a bold, custom feel to any athletic project, making it a winning choice for any high-impact design.

Our Favorite Tall Fonts

Still undecided? No problem. We’ve narrowed down the list and selected our top 12 best tall fonts just for you.

  • Bold Fonts
  • Edgy Fonts
  • Thin Fonts
  • Thick Fonts

Best Tall Fonts Summary

Choosing the right typefaces is crucial in making a visual statement and capturing the attention of your audience. When it comes to tall fonts, there are plenty of options to choose from that can enhance the aesthetic appeal of your designs, whether for personal projects or professional work.

Whether you’re looking for something modern, elegant, or playful, from premium options to free alternatives – there’s a tall font out there that can suit your needs.

By taking into account the factors mentioned in this blog post such as legibility, style, and versatility, you can make an informed decision and select the best tall font for your next project.

With the right choice of font, you can elevate the impact of your designs and create a memorable experience for your viewers.
